page.title: 12VILLAGE LIFE IN SOUTH STOKE
page.content: 'Life's quiet in a weekday, hectic weekends though, tourists parking all over. I couldn't live anywhere else, not in a street. A car's vital mind, no shops, no deliveries. School? Taxi fetches the child. Easy living here, me being a carpenter, but we'll have to leave when I can't drive any more. We're economical, grow the veg. collect wood, almost live for nothing. Problems? Once a year about twenty of us have a parish meeting, thrash thing out! I'm not a christian - wouldn't go to church elsewhere, but here - it's a friendly society, smoothes things. Undercurrents? Well, we have difficulties - take the man who won't have his dog neutered - our bitches are in trouble see! Festivals? Well there's Harvest when they come up river by boat from Arundel. Villagers must fit in, obey the rules like.
